title: Personal Leave of Absence
content:
Developer took a personal leave of absence due to physical discomfort and lack of focus.
Normal operations will resume shortly.

title: Plex is Acting Up
content:
Encountered an issue where Plex was exhibiting unexpected behavior.
Further investigation required.

title: Homelab Focus: Media Server Rework
content:
Taking a break from automation and website development to focus on the homelab.
Currently working on getting the media server operational.

title: Ice Cream Base Prep
content: Prepared the base for homemade ice cream for tomorrow's indulgence.

title: Developer Break
content: Taking a break to play some games and relax

title: Developer Break Announced Due to Back Pain
content:
The developer has announced a temporary break from coding due to severe back pain.
The current status of the project might be affected.

title: Social Media Links Updated
content:
All social media links have been successfully updated on the page.
This update ensures all platforms are correctly linked.

title: Homepage & Social Media Polish
content: Addressing issues with the homepage and organizing social media integration. A challenging but necessary task.

title: Location-Agnostic System Updates Enabled
content:
System is now location agnostic.
Users can now update from any location.

title: Initial Test Commit
content: First commit to test the automated changelog generation.

title: AI Schema Fix Verification
content: Verifying the new AI schema fix. This entry should have a proper Title and Status.

title: FORCED_SYSTEM_HALT
content:
Phase 1 of the automation is complete. I managed to brute-force the final scripts into submission last night before the inevitable hardware failure.

My brain successfully executed the logic gates required, but my physical chassis decided it had reached critical temperature. The titanium in my spine started throwing severe interrupt requests, forcing a non-graceful shutdown.

I crashed. Hard. I wasn't just tired; I was operating on negative sleep debt and pure spite. I hate that 'hustle culture' energy, but sometimes, getting the win means working until your body throws up its own blue screen. Time for a painful, but productive, morning reboot.

title: SYSTEM_STABILITY_ACHIEVED
content:
The glorious moment of non-intervention. I have successfully convinced the new system (after several painful reboots and a few choice words aimed at the power supply) that it can, in fact, run without my constant supervision.

I’m closing the blast doors now. The process is self-sustaining. This is the delicate dance where I back away slowly, trusting that the uptime timer doesn't immediately roll over into an apocalyptic 0xFFFFFFFF error the moment my foot leaves the rack.

If it survives the next 12 hours, I might actually trust it. Emphasis on *might*.

title: AUTONOMOUS_MODE_ENGAGED
content:
The machine has reached an uncomfortable level of self-sufficiency. 'Headless Mode' is confirmed, which means I no longer have to risk bending my geriatric, titanium-reinforced spine just to see a damn console.

The lab is now 'fully automated.' This is excellent news because I hate doing repetitive tasks. It is also deeply unsettling. I built this monster to help me, but the moment it stops needing its creator is the moment I start sleeping with a fire extinguisher nearby. Success confirmed, but paranoia levels are spiking.

title: CI_CD_PIPELINE_STATUS_GREEN_INITIATED
content:
The version control Gods demanded a blood sacrifice, and I almost gave them my last remaining shreds of patience. Git sync was acting like it had a titanium shard lodged in its cache.

Hours spent arguing with the upstream repository. It’s like wrestling a digital octopus—you fix three tentacles and the fourth hits you in the face.

But the line of commits is finally clean. The pipeline, which was flashing angry red error codes like a critical spine warning, is now green. We are live. The deployment is complete.

I should celebrate this glorious victory over automation, but my lumbar region just threw up an EADDRINUSE error, so I’m going to go lie down before I commit catastrophic hardware failure.

title: RESOURCE_ALLOCATION_CONFLICT: AUTO_MAINTENANCE
content:
Non-IT critical system failure: My personal mobility unit (aka the terrible car) requires mandatory, expensive maintenance.
I spent the morning playing financial Tetris, scheduling repairs, and praying the parts don't cost more than my entire Proxmox budget. The real world keeps injecting mandatory financial dependencies into my architecture. The lab build might have to wait while I fund this legacy hardware upgrade. This is far more stressful than debugging LVM issues.

title: GITHUB_REPOSITORY_EXPOSURE_PROTOCOL
content:
Took the plunge and exposed the current state of my project to the public internet. The GitHub repo is now live.
I crafted a detailed README, which is essentially a preemptive apology note for the horrific commit history. Opened the Discussion tab, because misery loves company. It’s vulnerable. Like me, but without the titanium reinforcement.

title: VECTOR_CORRECTION_APPLIED
content:
Quick fix deployed. Corrected the pathing error that was sending the output to the void. Target acquisition confirmed.
Sometimes the smallest adjustment means the difference between a successful compile and three hours of screaming at the screen. Today, I'll take the small wins.

title: MANDATORY SOCIAL COMPLIANCE
content: Fixed the highly critical, mandatory Facebook share button. Apparently, if users cannot immediately link our glorious content to Mark Zuckerberg's digital wasteland, the entire site is deemed useless. I stabilized the social_link_handler.js script. Yes, 'gottahave facebook'.

title: Traditional Greetings and Low Expectations
content:
System check returned the most basic payload possible. It seems even AI systems get lazy. Log output:

hello world

title: Payload Obfuscation Complete
content:
Secured the critical keys. Using nested directory structures and rotating the encryption vector daily.

The best place to hide secrets is right next to the documentation they already ignore. Running scrub -r on the original location just to be safe.

title: Physical Resources Exhausted
content: Critical system warning: The human interface device is reporting severe PAIN_STATE. Sitting duration has exceeded acceptable thresholds, leading to full-body resource depletion and severe fatigue. Initiating mandatory, though delayed, system shutdown (soon).

title: [CMD] FIREWALL RECONSTRUCTION COMPLETE
content: Cleaning up the network firewalls. Seriously, the initial configuration I setup when learning the UDM was a disaster zone. Rebuilt the core ruleset from scratch.

title: [BUG] VPN TUNNEL STABILIZATION
content: Tackling persistent VPN connectivity issues affecting one of the virtual machines residing on Proxmox. The handshake was getting sloppy.

title: [ERR] MEDIA_SERVER AUTH FAIL LOOP
content: Why is the media server suddenly acting like it doesn't know me? Endless, frustrating cycle of password issues. Starting to wonder if I accidentally applied a new policy or if the server is just spiteful.

title: [WARNING] AI LIMIT REACHED (AGAIN)
content: Seriously? My AI helper service keeps hitting its request limits, despite the premium subscription. Paying for IT support that stops working when you need it most is peak irony.

title: [WIP] BROKENITGUY.COM
content: General development and maintenance work on the website infrastructure.

title: [DEPLOY] V2.0 LOGS AUTOMATION ONLINE
content: Major update: Deployed the new welcome/intro page and, most importantly, fully automated the log posting mechanism. Now this process is slightly less manual pain.

title: [SCRIPT] PERSONAL AI PIPELINE FINE-TUNED
content: Finished internal scripting for personal AI automation workflows. Making the machines do the boring stuff.

title: [TEST] FOLDER MIGRATION VERIFICATION
content: Verifying permissions and accessibility for the recently migrated project folder structure. Just making sure I didn't break every link in the chain.

title: Firewall Cleanup: Fixing My Own Initial Mess
content: Cleaning up the firewalls and rebuilding them from scratch. This is phase 1 of fixing the monumental networking mess I created when I first started learning the UDM (Unifi Dream Machine) setup. Why does learning always involve breaking everything first?

title: Proxmox Server VPN Trauma
content: Spent time wrestling with a stubborn VPN connection issue affecting one of the key virtual servers running inside Proxmox. It decided today was a good day to stop talking to the outside world.

title: Media Server Password Amnesia
content: The media server has decided it hates me. Experiencing weird, persistent authentication failures and password issues that shouldn't logically be happening. I hate user permissions.

title: Paid AI Helper Reaches Rate Limit
content: Seriously? My AI helper keeps hitting arbitrary limits despite the fact that I am literally paying premium rates for infrastructure access. IT costs and arbitrary paywalls strike again.

title: Website Infrastructure Check
content: General maintenance and infrastructure checks on the main website deployment.

title: Log Automation Deployed
content: Major update to the website front end. Deployed the new welcoming/introductory landing page. Critically, I implemented the logs page and configured the automation hooks for posting entries.

title: Self-Automated AI Scripts Finished
content: Successfully finished setting up some custom, self-coded AI automation scripts. If I can automate my own work, maybe I won't have to rely on the helper that keeps limiting me.

title: Testing New Project Directory Structure
content: Final verification testing after migrating the main project directory structure to a new storage location. Fingers crossed no dependency paths broke during the move.

title: Firewall Cleanup: The Legacy Mess
content: Cleaning up the firewalls and attempting to rebuild sanity from the colossal mess I created when I first got the UDM and was clearly still learning how networking actually works.

title: Patching VPN Tunnels to Proxmox
content: Deep dive into fixing stubborn VPN connectivity issues tied to one of the specific Servers residing within the Proxmox environment. Why are the easy fixes never actually easy?

title: Authentication Hell: Media Server Login Loop
content: Experiencing inexplicable and frustrating password issues with my primary media server. It's probably user error from three months ago, but I’m blaming cosmic rays.

title: AI Helper Resource Limit Exceeded
content: The irony is painful: My paid, 'unlimited' AI helper keeps slamming into its usage limits. Apparently, paying for IT doesn't mean you get to use it for IT.

title: Website Deployment: Log Automation v1.0
content: Website deployment finalized. Updated the site with a proper welcome page and intro. Crucially, added the log page with integrated automation hooks for posting updates directly from these notes.

title: SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
content: Core infrastructure successfully deployed. Website is live. Socials are linked. The reboot sequence has completed without critical errors.
